intro: Hieracium kandalakschae, commonly known as the Kandalakshy hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the Russian Far East, specifically the Kandalaksha region. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, meadow-like habitats and has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are yellow and are arranged in a single head, with ray florets surrounding disk florets. Hieracium kandalakschae is a perennial species that is relatively rare and of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution.
